title: The Greatest Commandment
shortSummary: Deuteronomy 6 emphasizes the importance of wholehearted devotion to the one true God through obedience to His commandments. It instructs Israel to teach God's laws diligently to their children and to remember His faithfulness, especially after entering the Promised Land. This chapter contains the foundational Shema, a declaration of God's oneness and the call to love Him fully.
timeline: c. 1446 BC - Moses' final instructions to Israel before entering the Promised Land

keyCharacters.name: Moses
keyCharacters.description: The leader and prophet delivering God's commandments and exhortations to Israel before their entrance into Canaan.

keyCharacters.name: Israel
keyCharacters.description: The nation chosen by God to inherit the Promised Land and called to obey His statutes and commandments.

keyCharacters.name: Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob
keyCharacters.description: The patriarchs to whom God swore the promise of the land, referenced as the foundation of Israel’s inheritance.

definitions.definition: A Hebrew word meaning 'Hear,' referring to Deuteronomy 6:4-5, the central declaration of God's oneness and the command to love Him.
Small boxes or bands worn on the forehead and arm containing Scripture, symbolizing the keeping of God's law always before the believer.
A description of God’s zeal for exclusive worship, warning against idolatry and unfaithfulness.
God’s laws and decrees given to Israel to guide their moral, civil, and religious life.

outline.heading: Introduction to God’s Commandments and Their Purpose
outline.description: Moses introduces the commandments given by God to Israel, emphasizing the need to fear God and obey His laws to prosper in the Promised Land.

outline.heading: The Shema: The Oneness of God and the Command to Love Him
outline.description: The foundational declaration of monotheism and the greatest commandment to love God with all heart, soul, and might.

outline.heading: The Importance of Teaching and Remembering God’s Word
outline.description: Instructions to internalize God’s words and diligently teach them to children, using visible reminders in daily life.

outline.heading: Warning Against Forgetting God After Possession of the Land
outline.description: A caution to Israel not to forget God’s deliverance and to avoid idolatry, highlighting God’s jealousy and the consequences of disobedience.

outline.heading: Call to Obedience and Righteousness
outline.description: An exhortation to keep God’s commandments faithfully to enjoy His blessings and possess the land.

outline.heading: Teaching Future Generations About God’s Faithfulness
outline.description: Guidance on how to explain God’s laws and mighty acts to children, reinforcing obedience as righteousness.

application: Love God with all your heart, soul, and strength by prioritizing Him in every area of life.
Diligently teach biblical truths to your children and incorporate Scripture into daily conversations and routines.
Use visible reminders of God’s Word to keep His commandments at the forefront of your mind.
Guard against spiritual forgetfulness and idolatry by regularly recalling God’s faithfulness and deliverance.

keyVerses.text: Hear, O Israel: The LORD our God is one LORD:
keyVerses.significance: This verse declares the foundational truth of monotheism, central to Israel’s faith and Christian belief.

keyVerses.text: And thou shalt love the LORD thy God with all thine heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy might.
keyVerses.significance: This verse commands total devotion to God, forming the basis for all obedience and worship.

keyVerses.text: And thou shalt teach them diligently unto thy children, and shalt talk of them when thou sittest in thine house, and when thou walkest by the way, and when thou liest down, and when thou risest up.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights the importance of continual, intentional teaching of God’s Word within the family and daily life.

keyVerses.text: And the LORD commanded us to do all these statutes, to fear the LORD our God, for our good always, that he might preserve us alive, as it is at this day.
keyVerses.significance: This verse explains that obedience to God’s commands is for our good and preservation, underscoring the blessings of faithful living.
